definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: It was not long before he began to quarrel with his wife and later family conflicts were a usual practice.
sentences.chinese: 沒過多久他就和妻子爭吵起來，家庭衝突接連不斷。

sentences.english: A rash of self-mutilations by prison inmates is disturbing.
sentences.chinese: 監獄囚犯的自毀行爲接連不斷，令人擔憂。

sentences.english: In the US they appear to be succeeding.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，這些看起來在接連不斷的發生。

sentences.english: If the weather keeps raining, the sports meet will have to be postponed again.
sentences.chinese: 如果氣象接連不斷地下雨，運動會只能再脫期了。

sentences.english: Herdsmen come to see Gongjue living Buddha incessantly.
sentences.chinese: 牧民們還是接連不斷地來找貢覺活佛。

sentences.english: The long succession of wet days wore us out.
sentences.chinese: 長時間接連不斷的陰雨天使我們很厭煩。
